text:
e="preserve">Admiral Fasih Bokhari (فصیح بخارى; 8 March 1942 – 24 November 2020)), was a Pakistani four-star rank admiral in the Pakistan Navy. He was a pacifist, and politician. He was the Chief of Naval Staff from 1997 to 1999. He also was the Chairman of the National Accountability Bureau from 2011 to 2013.
Bokhari died on 24 November 2020 at the age of 78.
